author: dixondog
title: great!
review: this is a good set. it is an exclusive fig that you get with pre-orders of the lord of the rings video game. he is a great fig. he has both amazing front and back printing, plus a double sided head.  his hair is good, the same as legolas' hair bur in brown. his weapon is also quite nice.he can hold it with both hands or one, and it looks good both ways. the cape however, unlike in the picture, is a short blue cape, not a long one. the last thing is that, on my ratings i didn't want to anything on the price since it is a free fig, unless you buy it from another source like bricklink. so overall, it is a good set for a free polybag, so i would recommend buying him if you can get one for a good price.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Elrond is Free
review:
Set #5000202 Elrond: As another one of those special promotional items LEGO has decided to offer a Mini-Figure that is more than likely not going to be made available in any sets. Unless they make a similar, yet different printed version to ensure the value and rarity of this item.

Elrond is a brilliant looking Mini-Figure, so far my only LotR Elf I am quite impressed by the printing detail on this MF. He is sporting a golden torso with armor detail printing on both sides, I want to say armor from the third-age of Middle-Earth, unfortunately I am a bit rusty on the ages of ME. The legs are green, a light pea green color with printing of the leg armor.

The face features a determined looking expression and a open-mouthed yelling expression. He has some lines on his face that might indicate age, I'm not entirely certain of what detail LEGO was aiming at honestly, elves of LotR typically do not age. I think the detail is actually meant to offer up more realisim to the LEGO Mini-Fig design.

His hair piece is brilliant, I've read that it is simply Legolas' hair in Elrond's colors, if that is the case it still works as Elrond's hair. The paint work around the ears could stand a bit of polish, mine has a few minor dabs of pink flesh tone that look fairly sloppy. However as this is a freebie with the game, I can forgive minor imperfections.

Accessory wise he includes a golden bladed weapon, as seen in the game, and possibly in other sets though I don't know. I don't own anything much from the Theme yet, though I hope to change it. I suspect however this is a unique accessory for Elrond and added value.

Finally we come to his other accessory, one which has had some controversy in the LEGO collecting community, the cape. It is a short blue cape, which some criticize for being inacurrate and Hobbit-sized. The image on the bag does show a much longer cape. To be perfectly blunt, this is a free incentive for those who Pre-Order the game, it doesn't cost you one red cent if you were planning on buying the game originally. And even if you didn't plan on buying the game and were going to buy it now only for this MF alone... Why complain about something as trivial as a cape's length? I could understand if the accessory was not included, had been made in a different color, or even suffered from some kind of defect, to complain about the length alone seems to be nitpicking for nitpicking's sake.

However, this is understandably still something that not everyone will agree upon, I do not feel bothered by the length of the cape. Many have said it is Hobbit sized, now that I have it in hand and can actually see the issue they are raising, I have to say it doesn't bother this reviewer in the slightest. It actually looks rather impressive to see a smaller sized cape on a regular scaled Mini-Fig.

Ultimately it is truly up to you. This Mini-Figure has impressive detail-work, great looking accessories and all around looks great. Especially for a chinese made MF, yes it is Made in China, this too is a huge deal breaker for MF collectors. I can't recommend this item as a retail product, however I say if you're lucky enough to score this for free when picking up the game then there's really nothing that wrong with it. If you seriously hate the cape, well you could always give it to a shorter Mini-Fig.

author: headbrick
title: Amazing Polybag
review:
I am a huge fan of the Lord of the Rings so I couldn't pass up the chance to get this polybag.(especially since i was going to get the video game anyway) 

The fig is flawlessly produced. The torso is well printed and the legs go well with it. (unlike some) 

For me, the main focus of the fig is the elven spear. For some reason I thought that the staff part got larger at the top, just before the blade. Not so. A seamless transition is due for this kind of minifig. Personally, I can't wait to see what others use this piece for in MOCs.

Overall, The set is a buy. the only downside is that the cape is shorter than is shown on the front image. Never the less, a call to Lego quickly remedied that situation. I would even pay money for this set.

Hoped that this helped!
- HeadBrick

author: Ernst
title: Elrond; the Elven King
review:
Overall 5 bricks : I got my first LOTR "set" by coincidence when I bought (no pre order) the LOTR DS game for my son. Now why review a single minifigure ? Simply because it's a great one and worth the review and 5 bricks. Just over a month old and already a collectors-item certainly if you keep it bagged which I didn't. Assembled and ready to be admired or used in a MOC it's more valuable to me. This figure is the first in my LOTR quest, many (probably all of them) will follow.

Building 1 brick : Just like CMF's it is assembling, not building so 1 brick.

Parts 5 bricks : All great parts starting with the great hairpiece with elf-ears. Elrond's head is double faced with a shout and a grin, he shows some similarity with the movie. The unique torso and legs look great with underneath it I think an anguish. There is some discussion concerning the cape, but I think this small Dark Blue one fits the figure. The Golden sword looks awesome and a fierce weapon. I'm already curious how he will appear in The Council of Elrond.

Playability 4 bricks : The single figure has no playability but because it will be so usefull in LOTR setup's and other MOC's I reward it with 4 bricks.

Value 5 bricks : Getting it for free is already worth 5 bricks, if you see the value already after some months it will only increase. It is now already (still bagged) worth some € 25,00 so try and buy the game with the free Elrond polybag as long as it is available !!

author: lotrninja23
title: Phenominal Minifig!
review:
This is a very good exclusive set.  It is only available with the pre-order of The Lord of the Rings video game, as you may already know.

Elrond is a fantastic minifigure! 

He comes with great parts in all ways.

First off, he is the first minifig to wield the new elven blade part. 

He has a pearl gold torso (with gold arms and flesh hands). The torso has printing on both sides, with great detail everywhere.

He has olive green legs (which is a very rare leg color). Along with the torso, the legs have very good printing. 

He is also the first minifig to have brown elf hair (which is a very intricate and awesome piece BTW).

He is has a double sided head, one side is a casual smile and the other side seams to be a yelling emotion.

All these this are great, but there is one problem to this minifig.  He comes with a SHORT cape, instead of the long cape he is pictured with. Nonetheless he is only the second minifig to have a dark blue short cape (Barriss Offee being the first).

Regardless of the cape being short, Elrond is one of my favorite minifigures of all time!

author: klatu003
title: Elrond Halfelven Immortal and Elven-wise
review: As a LOTR nut from way back, I was disappointed in this minifig when I received the short cape version. Yes, it was free, but I really bought the game to get the figure.  I haven’t been able to get past the lava room…..  That said, I used the missing part function of Lego.com to ask for the correct cape and noting that Elrond looked silly with the short cape.  I received the part 6024597 and a personalized, very cute letter from Lego.  The new cape is perfect with the slimmer design in the shoulders.  Elrond now looks like a leader of elves and men and can stand with Glorfindel (from Helm’s Deep) with pride.

author: Sauron_Bauglir
title: The should-have-been High King of the Ñoldor deserves a better figure!
review:
Elrond is one of my favourite Lord of the Rings characters, and one of the most powerful & important.  Therefore, he deserves one of the best, most well thought out Lego minifigures.  But on the contrary- he got a bad colour scheme, and problems with the parts!

Box/Instructions

Elrond came with no box/instructions, just a plastic bag attached to the video game box.

Parts

The parts you are supposed to get for Elrond are not bad, but not great.  The cape is nice, and the head, hair and body, but Lego could have done better.  But the colour of the legs that they gave Elrond is some sickly shade of green, which looks terrible and wrong!  It puts me off the figure a bit...

Then there is the- quite good- dark blue cape you are supposed to get.  Instead of a full-sized cape, I was given a Hobbit-sized cape, which looks wrong and TERRIBLE!  I swapped it for a black cape which I already had, which looks almost dark blue, but not brilliant.  This was a major flaw in this figure.

Minifigures

Elrond holding his Elven sword, which doesn't look very swordy, is hard to stand up without a Lego plate to put him on.  He is a good minifigure, although flawed.

The build

Obviously, there wasn't much to build...

Summary

I was quite disappointed with this minifigure for Lord Elrond Half-Elven, and I thought it could have been much better.  I am looking forward to 'The Council of Elrond' set in 2013!!

author: chrisbstm
title: A fine gift indeed...
review:
One of my neighbors dropped by and gave me this as a gift today! I had seen it on brickset, but seeing as how I don't own a gaming system anymore, had given it up as a polybag not for me. Anyhow my friend has been working part time at GameStop, and they had a surplus, so he snagged me one. 
On to the review. 
The minifigure has 2 faces, 1 stern, and the other shouting, he came with a hairpiece featuring a braid and ears, a nice olive cape and a gold bladed staff.
 His body has printing on both sides with gold and silver accents. Very royal looking. 
The legs also feature printing. 
Overall, a nice figure if you can get your hands on it. Made a nice addition to my mirkwood elf and bags end sets.
